Pre-Game Insights: Canada and Uruguay will face off in the third-place match of the Copa America
The match will take place at the Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte, North Carolina, with the kick-off scheduled for 20:00
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jesse Marsch has not yet announced his starting lineup, but he may rotate his squad after some strong performances from substitutes such as Ismaël Koné and Tani Oluwaseyi
Mathieu Choinière, who made his tournament debut in the semi-finals, could also feature if Marsch wants to freshen up his team
Alphonso Davies had to undergo X-rays after a tackle that forced him off the field at the 71st minute. Fortunately, no problems were detected and he could return to the starting lineup
Others: Uruguay could be without key players after incidents involving supporters celebrating Colombia's victory over Uruguay on Wednesday

The South American Football Confederation (Conmebol) announced on Thursday that it is launching an investigation into the violent incidents, including Darwin Nunez of Uruguay, but no sanctions have been announced yet
Marcelo Bielsa, Uruguay's coach, has stated that his players deserve apologies, not sanctions, following the incidents
